Description: The Leaflet Storymaps code template is designed to guide readers along a point-by-point tour, with a scrolling narrative to display text, images, audio, video, and scanned map backgrounds. Readers can follow the scrolling narrative or click on any marker to go directly to a specific chapter. You can create your own version by entering your map data into a linked Google Sheet (or CSV file) and uploading it into a free GitHub repository to host online. Learn more in our book, Hands-On Data Visualization.

Media Credit: By Alek Leckszas - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0
Description: The city of Los Angeles was established in the year 1871. Originally, this city was part of the Spanish colonization. Now it is home to plenty of action movies and exciting scenery among other items

Right-click on the tiny "View data" link at the bottom of the map to open the contents of the linked Google Sheet in a new tab. Each row is a chapter, which contains the text of the story, links to media, and data about each point on the map. The Google Sheet also includes an "Options" tab with global settings for the overall map appearance.
Little Tokyo is a Japanese district in downtown LA highlighting Japanese-American culture. It has one of the biggest Japanese populations in the US
The Petersen Automotive Museum is home to one of the largest automotive collections in the United States. Located in the neighborhood, Miracle Mile, it's a hotspot for many automotive enthusiasts.
Location: Petersen Automotive Museum, Los Angeles, California

Media Credit: Source: Arnold C, Attribution, via Wikimedia Commons
Description: Chinatown is an ethnic center for many Chinese and Asian-American businesses. Chinatown is full of restaurants and shops, along with its own residential buildings.

Media Credit: Cd637, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
Description:
Disneyland is a theme park in California, serving the community since 1955.

Disneyland is by far one of the most popular destinations in California

Media Credit: Source: The City of Santa Monica, California
Description: Santa Monica Pier is a popular destination for many tourists. It's an amusement park on the pier, with a great view for fishing along with a concession stand.
Location: Santa Monica Pier, Los Angeles, California

Description: Venice Beach is a boardwalk full of shops, restaurants, and performers. This is also the place where "White Men Can't Jump" was filmed. This place also has an outdoor gym and skatepark.

Media Credit: Source:  Mr Bullitt, CC BY-SA 3.0 <http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/>, via Wikimedia Commons
Description: Sunset Boulevard is a famous California street that extends from near the pacific ocean towards the inner city of Los Angeles. This street has many attractions.

The code template assigns each chapter a unique web address that ends with a numerical hashtag (such as ...#12). This corresponds to the spreadsheet row number, not the marker number column, which may be duplicated or hidden. This means you can send people links to specific chapters, or refer back to another chapter in this storymap, such as this internal link to chapter 3.
To learn more about the Leaflet Storymaps with Google Sheets template, see our book: Hands-On Data Visualization.
